summary: A small trick enables ambient occlusion on NVIDIA cards. Greatly improves the look of Skyrim.
descriptionHtml:
There is a simply trick to enforce ambient occlusion on nvidia cards: Download the newest beta driver and enable it in the nvidia control center. Or use nvidia Inspector to edit the Skyrim-profile and enable ambient occlusion there. You might want to change your bTreesReceiveShadows setting afterwards. See images for details.

This trick was not my idea. I am just spreading this here because I found this very helpful and this technique seem not to be overly well known. I hope others might find this useful, like I did.

See original author\'s description decription of this video:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i7Z8RKcCnJA

Remarks:
-Works fine with post process injector.
-If someone know how to do this on ATI cards, please post in comments and I will change description accordingly.
-An excellent in-depth description of this and other teaks can be found at (thx ActiusRex):
http://www.geforce.com/Optimize/Guides/five-fast-elder-scrolls-v-skyrim-tweaks-guaranteed-to-make-your-game-look-even-better
- In spots such as foggy caves, ambient occlusion can look bad.
author: McLoud
